com.crazedout.jsun

Class JSun

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.crazedout.jsun.JSun

  • public class JSun
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class to serialize objects to Json object / string.
    User specified key/value pairs or
    declared public or protected getters on Object will be parsed to Json string.
         
         Examples:
         JSun js = new JSun();
         js.put("id",4);
         js.put("name","Uthred");
         js.put("alive", false);
         String jStr = js.eval();
          {"id":4,"name":"Uthred","alive":false}

         js.clear();
         List beatlesList = new ArrayList<>();
         beatlesList.add(new Person("John", "Guitar"));
         beatlesList.add(new Person("Paul", "Bass"));
         beatlesList.add(new Person("George", "Guitar"));
         beatlesList.add(new Person("Ringo", "Drums"));
         js.put("Beatles", beatlesList);
         String jsonString = js.eval();
         {"Beatles":[{"name":"John","instrument":"Guitar"},{"name":"Paul","instrument":"Bass"},
            {"name":"George","instrument":"Guitar"},{"name":"Ringo","instrument":"Drums"}]}
    It's highly recommended to use the Project Lombrok and it's Getter and Setter annotations f√∂r JSun objects.
    See Also:
    @JSunClass

      Generates Json string as {"key":[val1,val2,val3...]}

      Generates Json string as {"key":[obj1,obj2,obj3...]}

      • JSun

        public JSun(java.lang.Object obj)
        Creates a JSun for obj.
        All declared public and protected getters (e.i getName()) will be jsonified.
        The Class of obj should be annotated with @JSunClass annotation, but any pojo will work.
        With @JSunClass getters can be excluded as @JSunClass(exclude={"id","title"}.
        Parameters:
        obj - Object to be Json serialized.

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public static void eval(java.lang.String javascriptString)
                 throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Evaluates the input javascript string through
        ScriptEngine JavScript eval().
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - if scriptEngine.eval(javascriptString) fails.

      • eval

        public java.lang.String eval()
                      throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Evaluates the json string of this JSun object through
        ScriptEngine JavScript eval() and returns string.
        Returns:
        json string
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - if scriptEngine.eval("JSON.parse('" + toJsonString() +"');") fails.

        public void clear()
        Clear all keys and values.

        public void put(java.lang.String key,

        value - Json value
